intro: Cupania sordida, commonly known as the sordid cupania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically pink or white, and are followed by capsule fruits. Cupania sordida is characterized by its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
